For a thrilling war movie, "There Be Dragons" (2011) starring Lily Cole and Dougray Scott would be a great choice. The film explores the horrors of the Spanish Civil War through a compelling narrative. 

If you prefer something more procedural and suspenseful, "Zero Effect" (1998) starring Angela Featherstone and Jake Kasdan would be a good option. The film features a complex case of blackmail and missing keys, with plenty of twists and turns.

If you're looking for something more light-hearted and humorous, "Tora! Tora! Tora!" (1970) starring James Whitmore and James Whitmore is a great choice. The film depicts the chaotic and destructive effects of an air raid on Pearl Harbor, with plenty of laughs and memorable moments.
